title: ISic001308. Funerary inscription for Kornelios Agathemeros
body:
Facsimile Images

1❦ΘΚ❦
2ΚΟΡΝΗΛΙΟΣΑΓΑ
3ΘΗΜΕΡΟΣΕΖΗ
4ΣΕΝΕΤΗXXXVIII
5ΕΥΦΡΟΣΥΝΗΙΔΙΩΣΥΝ
6ΒΙΩΜΝΗΜΗΣΧΑΡΙΝ

Apparatus criticus

  • text from photograph

English translation

To the gods of the underworld. Kornelios Agathemeros lived 38 years. Euphrosyne (set this up) as a memorial for her own partner in life.

Italian translation

Agli dèi del mondo sotterraneo. Kornelios Agathemeros ha vissuto 38 anni. Eufrosia (lo pose) a ricordo del proprio compagno di vita.

commentary

This epitaph was found together with ISic001314 (inv. no.272), which was apparently erected by the same man as is commemorated in this text (although it is also possible that they are father and son). The implication is that Euphrosyne was his second wife, who outlived him. The use of Latin numerals in the middle of the Greek text is a clear indication of the co-existence of the two languages in Catania at this date and the ‘interference’ between them (just as the name Cornelius Agathemeros combines Latin and Greek names also).

bibliography

  • 14.0485 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 73 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • 3.5695 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
